([[Madrid]], [[Spain]]; [[January 29]], [[2004]]) | World cup apps = | World cup first = | World cup best = | Regional cup name = | Regional cup apps = | Regional cup first = | Regional cup best = }} '''Finnish national futsal team''' represents [[Finland]] in the international [[futsal]] competitions. Team is run under supervision of the [[Football Association of Finland]]. National futsal team has never qualified for [[FIFA Futsal World Cup|World Cup]] or [[UEFA Futsal Championship|European Championship]]. == History == Finnish national futsal team was formed for the first time in 1994 when Finland participated in World University Futsal Championship held in [[Cyprus]]. World University Futsal Championship was held in [[JyvÃ¤skylÃ¤]], Finland two years later. The first official internationals were played on October 21 and 22, 1998 against [[Hungary national futsal team|Hungary]]. Later that year Finland also participated in qualifiers to [[1999 UEFA Futsal Championship]] with futsal national team coach [[Timo Liekoski]]{{cite web|url=http://www.futsal.fi/maajoukkue/maaottelut_1998-/|title=Maaottelut 1998-|publisher=Suomen Palloliitto |date= |accessdate=2009-11-03}}, but failed to qualify.{{cite book| title= Rakas jalkapallo â sata vuotta suomalaista jalkapalloa | coauthors=YrjÃ¶ Lautela & GÃ¶ran WallÃ©n | publisher=Teos | year=2007 | pages = 264â265 | id=ISBN 978-951-851-068-3 }} [[Simo SyrjÃ¤vaara]] was selected as national futsal team coach at the end of year 1999.{{cite news|title=Futsalmaajoukkue Simo SyrjÃ¤vaaran komentoon|newspaper=Helsingin Sanomat |date=31.10.1999}} During SyrjÃ¤vaara's spell team participated twice in [[FIFA Futsal World Cup|FIFA Futsal World Championship]] qualifiers and three times in [[UEFA Futsal Championship]] qualifiers. In these qualifiers teams won only twice and lost total of 14 times. After SyrjÃ¤vaara stepped down and rising talent [[Jouni Pihlaja]] took over coaching the team from the beginning of year 2005. == International Competitions == === World Cup === * [[1989 FIFA Futsal World Championship|1989]] - ''did not compete'' * [[1992 FIFA Futsal World Championship|1992]] - ''did not compete'' * [[1996 FIFA Futsal World Championship|1996]] - ''did not compete'' * [[2000 FIFA Futsal World Championship|2000]] - ''did not qualify'' * [[2004 FIFA Futsal World Championship|2004]] - ''did not qualify'' * [[2008 FIFA Futsal World Cup|2008]] - ''did not qualify'' === Futsal Euro
